thread.title: Dozens detained as opposition activists hold protests in several Russian cities (WATCH LIVE)
thread.title_full: Dozens detained as opposition activists hold protests in several Russian cities (WATCH LIVE)

author: RT
title: Dozens detained as opposition activists hold protests in several Russian cities (WATCH LIVE)
text:
Dozens detained as opposition activists hold protests in several Russian cities (WATCH LIVE) Published time: 26 Mar, 2017 12:10 Edited time: 26 Mar, 2017 12:32 Get short URL An opposition supporter (C) blocks a police van transporting detained anti-corruption campaigner and opposition figure Aleksey Navalny during a rally in Moscow, Russia, March 26, 2017. © Maxim Shemetov / Reuters Several opposition rallies, most of which were unsanctioned, took place in Russia on Sunday. A number of people were detained for disorderly conduct. Opposition figure Aleksey Navalny is among those detained in central Moscow. 
Navalny was detained shortly after showing up for the event in the center of the Russian capital, media report. — An Bo (@ann_bo_) March 26, 2017 
He and a number of other protesters came despite failing to receive permission from the mayor’s office to hold a rally at the site of their choosing. The authorities suggested two alternative locations for the event, but the organizers rejected them. 
READ MORE: Kremlin warns Navalny supporters against unsanctioned rall Anti-corruption campaigner and opposition figure Aleksey Navalny waves as he sits inside a police van after after being detained during a rally in Moscow, Russia, March 26, 2017. © Maxim Shemetov 
Protests, some sanctioned and others in violation of a municipal ban, took place in other Russian cities on Sunday, including Novosibirsk, Barnaul, Tomsk, Krasnoyarsk, Khabarovsk, and Vladivostok. 4 минуты назад начался митинг в Екатеринбурге #ДимонОтветит @navalny pic.twitter.com/zHRficDSNm — d (@ltfitw) March 26, 2017 
The rally in Novosibirsk, which was sanctioned by the local authorities after a court ordered them to overturn a ban, attracted around 1,500 people, according to the mayor’s office. At another sanctioned event in Tomsk, around 400 protesters showed up, according to local law enforcement. — Арсений Веснин (@ars_ves) March 26, 2017 
In Vladivostok, 25 activists have been detained by police for trying to violate a ban on public gatherings. 
Navalny called on his supporters to protest on Sunday, weeks after releasing a report on the alleged corruption of Russian Prime Minister Dmitry Medvedev. He accused the head of the Russian government of personal enrichment through embezzlement.
